data.text:
Nov. 13, 1931-May 26, 2011

Age: 79

Residence: Albuquerque, N.M.

Jack Cooper was born Nov. 13, 1931, in Ft. Madison, Iowa, to Helen and Harley Cooper. He attended school in Ft. Madison, Iowa. He worked five years for the Santa Fe Railroad, served four years in the Air Force.

He moved to Greeley in 1958 and worked 36 years for Monforts, retiring in 1997.

Jack married Gerlinde Blehm in 1974.

Survivors include: wife, Gerlinde; son, Scott Cooper of Greeley; daughters Sherri Hicks of Greeley, Jackie Swine of Oklahoma; stepchildren Doreen Henry of Greeley, Debbie Jensen of N.M.; 12 grandchildren; two great-grandchildren; brother Ronald Cooper of Greeley; sisters Kay Johnson of Burlington, Iowa; Beverly Watson of Topeka, Kan.

He is preceded in death by his parents; brother, Richard Dale; stepson, Danny Blehm; stepdaughter, Becky Schmidt.

Oct. 22, 1926-May 30, 2011

Age: 84

Irma Jane Jordan was born Oct. 22, 1926, to Fred and Lydia Miller in Timnath, Colo.

Irma was a graduate of the class of 1944 of Fort Collins High School.

She married Richard E. Jordan on Jan. 8, 1945, in Fort Collins.

Irma is survived by three sons, Richard L. Jordan (Kathy) of Laporte, Colo., Charles W. Jordan of McCook, Neb., Stanley D. Jordan of Windsor, Colo.; one daughter, Jolene S. (Jon) Lind of Burlington, Colo.; 10 grandchildren; 19 great-grandchildren; two sisters; Esther Kurtz, and Aldine Winick; and many nieces and nephews.

She is preceded in death by her parents, husband, brother, Ben Miller and sister, Helen Guffey.

In lieu of flowers memorial gifts can be sent to Marks Funeral Home or to the foundation of your choice. Memorial service is scheduled for 10 a.m. Friday at Marks Funeral Home in Windsor.

Sept. 1, 1972-May 26, 2011

Age: 38

Residence: Greeley

Darrell David Salazar, 38, of Greeley, died on May 26, 2011, at Swedish Medical Center. He was born Sept. 1, 1972, in Espanola, Mexico, to Brigido and Andelesia (Archuleta) Salazar.

Darrell graduated from Espanola High School and Universal Technical Institute.

He married Nichole Johnson on March 17, 2001, in Las Vegas, N.M. He was formerly from Santa Cruz, N.M., and moved to Greeley in 2004.

He worked for Weld County Garage and was a GM World Class Technician and ASE Master Certified Technician for the past seven years.

He was a member of the Santa Cruz Catholic Church, was a wonderful husband and father and a motorcycle enthusiast.

Survivors include his wife, Nichole Salazar; children, Michael, Marie, Benjamin and Camille; mother, Ann Salazar; brothers, Martin Lopez, Michael and Charles Salazar and Berlyn and wife Bernie Salazar all of Santa Cruz, N.M.; nieces and nephews, Bryan, Jeremy, Leo, Lean, and Stephanie; mother-in-law, Jan Ivey-Moore of Greeley; father-in-law, Jessie Moore of Las Vegas, N.M. He was preceded by his father and a brother, Leo.

A service will be held at 10 a.m. Saturday, June 4, at the Allnutt Macy Chapel. Inurnment Linn Grove Cemetery. A reception will follow at VFW Post #2121, Garden City. In lieu of flowers, memorial gifts may be made to the Darrell Salazar memorial fund in care of Allnutt, 702 13th St., Greeley, CO 80631. Friends may view the online obituary, sign the guest book & send condolences at www.allnutt.com.
